text:
This may be an addon to Bug 1477, but it would be a good idea to update the DTD 
listed at http://www.sdv.fr/pages/casa/html/ant-dtd.en.html or update the DTD 
that antStructure generates.

Why doesn't antStructure know about required attributes?

I've been working on an Ant DTD that is based on the 1.3 documentation, where 
can I submit it for review?

To address Bug 1477's issue, a W3C Shema definition for the build XML files can 
specify data type information.  For example, I created a Schema that has a type 
called antBoolean that can be yes|no|true|false|on|off.  In a Schema, the 
antBoolean type can be applied to all boolean types and when using an editor 
that understands schemas, the type can be enforced.  The schema could be easily 
extended for new tasks created by a user or for new built-in or optional tasks.

text:
Thanks for the suggestion. I think that with the growing number of tasks for
Ant, a single DTD is not feasible now. For editing purposes the custom DTD built
by antstructure is the way to go, IMHO. If you have problems with that DTD,
pleae let us know.

A schema version of antstructure might be a worthy enhancement.
